column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Five Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Sunday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 377 cases of coronavirus were reported on Sunday
column5: 806 on Saturday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.Up-to-date hospital numbers will not be available until Monday as the Department of Health does not update its Covid-19 dashboard at weekends.On Friday
column7: there were 397 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column8: up from 387 on Thursday.There were 34 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column9: down from 37 on Thursday.Last updated 14 November at 14:10 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column11: 111 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Sunday.Last updated 14 November at 14:15 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3
